title: 110_hr4237
content: The Act is titled the "Overseas Voting Practical Amendments Act of 2007". The official federal form is designated as the Federal Voter Registration and Ballot Application. Designation and Distribution of official Federal Voter Registration and Ballot Application forms are amended under the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act. State responsibilities and the use of a single application for all subsequent elections are also modified. Amendments to the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act include changing the official post card form to the official Federal Voter Registration and Ballot Application. Amendments to the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act involve replacing the official post card form with the official Federal Voter Registration and Ballot Application. SEC. 3 prohibits refusal to accept applications, ballots, and materials for not meeting nonessential requirements. The Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act is amended to prohibit states from refusing valid voter registration or absentee ballot applications based on nonessential requirements. The Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act prohibits states from rejecting voter registration or absentee ballot applications for nonessential reasons, such as notarization, delivery method, or paper requirements. The Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act prohibits states from rejecting valid absentee ballots for failing to meet nonessential requirements determined by the Presidential designee. The Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act prohibits states from rejecting valid absentee ballots for various reasons such as ballot production, paper requirements, notarization, delivery method, and accompanying documents. The Presidential designee can reject absentee ballots if they do not meet necessary requirements to prevent fraud in elections. SEC. 4. REQUIRING CLARIFICATION OF POSTAGE MARKINGS ON CERTAIN BALLOTING MATERIALS MAILED BY STATES. Section 3406 of title 39, United States Code is amended to require states to clarify postage markings on balloting materials for absentee voters under the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act. The state must ensure the address includes 'United States of America' or 'USA' and clarify if postage paid applies only domestically or also for overseas mailing through military post offices. Section 5 addresses the provision of ballots in subsequent elections. Section 104 of the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act is amended to allow voters to request absentee ballots in all subsequent elections, waive the requirement to provide absentee ballots to individuals with unknown addresses, and permit early submission of requests during the previous year. Section 104(e) of the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act is amended to remove specific phrases related to the timing of absentee ballot requests. SEC. 6. Application of UOCAVA to individuals never residing in the United States whose parents are overseas voters. Amends Section 107(5)(C) of the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act to include individuals who have never resided in the United States but would be qualified to vote in the last place where their parent or guardian was domiciled before leaving the United States. SEC. 7 amends the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act to require prompt notification of rejection of voter registration or absentee ballot request. SEC. 8 allows the use of diplomatic pouch for returning completed absentee ballots. Section 101(c) of the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act is amended to allow the use of diplomatic pouch for returning completed absentee ballots if delivered to an overseas facility of the Department of State not earlier than 14 days prior to the election date, and if no effective alternative is available at the facility for the overseas voter to ensure timely delivery. The amended Section 101(c) of the Uniformed and Overseas Citizens Absentee Voting Act allows the use of diplomatic pouch for returning completed absentee ballots if delivered to an overseas facility of the Department of State not earlier than 14 days prior to the election date, and if no effective alternative is available for the overseas voter to ensure timely delivery. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for elections occurring after the 45-day period from the enactment date.
